oai_dc:dc.dc:title: AFA Goes to Washington
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Whittaker, Jamie
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The AFA board of directors, along with some interested AFA members, visited Capitol Hill after the quarterly board meeting in May. Brent Gattis, second vice-president of AFA, spends his days on The Hill lobbying against restrictive legislation. The board met with several members of Congress and advisors to make sure that the concerns of bird owners are heard.The board also met ith the Department of Fish and Wildlife for clarification on the...
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AFA Watchbird; Vol. 42 No. 3 & 4 (2015): Vol 42, No 3 & 4 (2015); 61
